titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Islamic Manuscripts Collection, 10th century - 19th century
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Emma Gronbeck, January 2025.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Codices and manuscript leaves from different parts of the Islamic World, primarily of the Qur'an and excerpts of the Qur'an. Also includes scholarly and literary works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Codices and manuscript leaves from different parts of the Islamic World, primarily of the Qur'an and excerpts of the Qur'an. Also includes scholarly and literary works. The majority of materials originate from historic Persia (modern day Iran) and the Ottoman Empire.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Emma Gronbeck, October 2024. Updated, January 2025.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Emma Gronbeck, October 2024. Updated, January 2025.

All items in this collection have been catalogued bibliographically and their catalog records can be viewed by searching the Vassar College Libraries Online Catalog or by following the links in the item call numbers listed below.
Arabic MS 2, 8 and 9 were separated from the Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts Collection and incorporated into this collection, January 2024.
Arabic MS 11 was separated from the Ernest Sturm Collection and catalogued as part of the Islamic Manuscripts Collection, January 2025.
Persian MS 6 was separated from the Ruth Lamb Atkinson Papers and catalogued as part of the Islamic Manuscripts Collection, January 2025.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Arabic MS 1 is of unknown origin.
Arabic MS 2, 8, and 9 are of unknown origin, possibly acquired from bookseller Otto F. Ege.
Arabic MS 3 was the gift of William Bancroft Hill, 1932.
Arabic MS 4 and 10 were the gift of Elizabeth Howe (VC 1882), 1929.
Arabic MS 5 was the gift of Mildred E. Cook, 1959.
Arabic MS 6 was the gift of Janet (Bartlett) Cartwright (VC 1921), Jul 1957.
Arabic MS 7 was the gift of Ethel M. Fair (VC 1906), Nov 1971. Given to her by the Council and Faculties of the American University at Cairo in 1952.
Arabic MS 11 was the gift of Ruth Foster Sturm, 1997. It was collected by her father, Ernest Sturm.
Persian MS 1-4 and Turkish MS 1-2 were the bequest of Frederick F. Thompson, 1924.
Persian MS 5 was the gift of Ada Thurston (VC 1880), 1939.
Persian MS 6 was the gift of Ruth Lamb Atkinson (VC 1918), 1975.
Turkish MS 3 was the gift of Helen (Morgenthau) Fox (VC 1905), 1940.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Islamic Manuscripts Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

did.unittitle: A Leaf from a Qur'an, in Arabic (Maghribi Kufic script) [North Africa],
did.physdesc: [framed leaf in wooden case, 160 mm x 100 mm]

did.unittitle: A Leaf from a Qur'an (Sūrat al-Rūm), in Arabic (Maghribi script),
did.physdesc: [240 mm x 215 mm; Previously Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts Collection, Leaf 51]

did.unittitle: Ṭabarsī, al-Faḍl ibn al-Ḥasan (-1153), Hādhā Nathr al-La'ālī li-'Alī 'alayhi al-salām, in Arabic (Naskh script) [Persia],
Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥusayn (-710?), A Leaf from Ṣaḥīfah al-Sajjādīyah, a book of supplications attributed to Imam Zayn al-Abidin (ca. 658–712), in Arabic [Persia],
did.physdesc: [175 mm x 125 mm; Previously Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts Collection, Leaf 73]

did.unittitle: Jazūlī, Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān (1404-1465), A Leaf from Dalāʼil al-khayrāt [The Guide to Goodness], a compilation of prayers and salawat for the Prophet Muhammad, in Arabic,
did.physdesc: [165 mm x 110 mm; Previously Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts Collection, Leaf 70]

did.unittitle: Amīr Khusraw Dihlavī (approximately 1253-1325), Majnūn va Laylī [Book of Leili and Majnoon] [Persia],
Fragment of Amīr Arsalān Nāmdār by Muḥammad ʿAlī Naqīb [Persia],
Five leaves from Haft Paykar by Niẓāmī Ganjavī (1140 or 1141-1202 or 1203) [Persia],
Erzurumlu İbrâhim Hakkı (1703-1780?), Ma'rifet-nāme, in Ottoman Turkish (Naskh script) [Ottoman Empire],

p.emph: A scholarly encyclopedia covering, among other subjects, astronomy, astrology, anatomy, physiology, psychology, physics, mathematics, biology, geometry, physiognomy, faith, and Sufism.

did.unittitle: Kâtip Çelebi [Hajji Khalifa] (1609-1657), Cihannümâ, in Ottoman Turkish (Naskh script) [Ottoman Empire],

p.emph: This work is a comprehensive universal geographical history, featuring several colorful maps and atlases of various regions of the world. Marginal correction by the same scribe throughout.

did.unittitle: Prayer Book, in Turkish and Arabic (Naskh script) [Ottoman Empire],
